page.title: 01INTRODUCTION: GREAT BOLAS
page.content: Orleton Park School surveyed the block 4 by 3 km from grid ref. 0364 0321. The main land use is agricultural and the two main villages are Eaton Upon Tern and Great Bolas. The area is very sparcely populated for there seems to be only one pub and one church to serve the area. The River Tern and the River Meese drain the area and they meander from North to South and East to West. On our first survey of Great Bolas most of us found it difficult to follow our maps as the footpaths shown on the maps were non existent. One man,Mr.J. Faulkner Irving at one time used to own the whole village of Eaton Upon Tern. He and his brother planted a row of chestnut trees to celebrate the end of the war in 1945. The industry of the area consists of two things the Agriculture,Airfield.
